histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.BrightnessChange.Cause
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. This enum states the reason why the model also thinks brightness should be changed. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.ModelIteration
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. We also log the number of model iterations if we've set to use personal curve only. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.NoBrightnessChange.Cause
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. This enum states the reason why the model doesn't think brightness should be changed. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.Unknown.AlsStd
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. We also log the als-stddev in its averaging period. This metric records the als-stddev when the associated als-delta is unknown. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.{AlsBrightnessDirection}AlsDelta
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. We also log the als-delta from the previous log-lux (when brightness was last changed) to the current log-lux, which includes both the sign of the als-delta and its absolute value. Chrome OS only. {AlsBrightnessDirection}

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.AdapterDecisionAtUserChange.{AlsBrightnessDirection}AlsStd
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, we will ask the model whether it also thinks brightness should be changed. We also log the als-stddev in its averaging period. We log it separately for the case when the associated als-delta is positive and negative. Chrome OS only. {AlsBrightnessDirection}

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.DailyUserAdjustment.Atlas
histogram.summary: Number of times that a user has made brightness adjustments on an Atlas device with an ambient sensor that is supported by the auto screen brightness model. Reported daily. The count is accumulated through the day, spanning reboots, and sent once the system clock indicates that a full day or more has passed since the last report. If the system is suspended or off for more than a day, the current count will be reported immediately the next time the system boots, but the skipped days will not be reported. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.DataError
histogram.summary: Type of error seen when handling data related to automatic screen brightness adjustments. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ElapsedTimeBetweenModelAndUserAdjustments
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from a model brightness adjustment to the next user manual brightness change. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.GlobalCurveResetOnInitialization
histogram.summary: Whether the global curve is reset at initialization.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.InvalidCurveReason
histogram.summary: A monotone cubic spline curve may be invalid from input that used to generate it. This metric records why it's invalid. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.MissingAlsWhenBrightnessChanged
histogram.summary: Whether there was no recorded ALS reading when brightness was changed.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.MissingPriorUserBrightnessRequest
histogram.summary: Under the current implementation of brightness monitor, user brightness request should be received before brightness change signal. Adapter operates under this assumption. This metric logs an error if a brightness change signal is received without a prior brightness request signal. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelIterationCountAtInitialization
histogram.summary: Personal model iteration count when modeller is initialized. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelLoadingStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the model loading from disk. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelTraining.BrightnessChange
histogram.summary: Whether a new brightness exceeds the preset bound that defines reasonble range of change. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelTraining.BrightnessOutlier
histogram.summary: Whether a training data is an outlier and should be discarded by the model during training. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelTraining.Inaccuracy.NoUpdate
histogram.summary: When training data comes in, the model may or may not be updated. We measure the error of the model as compared with the target value from training data. This metric measures the error when model is not updated. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelTraining.Inaccuracy.Update
histogram.summary: When training data comes in, the model may or may not be updated. We measure the error of the model as compared with the target value from training data. This metric measures the error when model is updated. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ModelTraining.ModelUserConsistent
histogram.summary: Whether user brightness change is consistent with the model so that model is not updated.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.NewCurveSaved.Duration
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between training start and a new curve saved to disk. Only reported if a new curve was created and saved successfully to disk. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.NewCurveSaved.Success
histogram.summary: Whether a new curve was successfully saved to disk. Only reported if a new curve was created during the training process. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.Opposite.UserModelBrightnessAdjustments
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, if the previous change was caused by the model, then we log bucketized absolute brightness changes of the two adjustments. This metric records changes if they are in the opposite directions. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.ParameterError
histogram.summary: When there is an error in the automatic screen brightness parameters, this records which kind of parameter is invalid. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.PersonalCurveValid
histogram.summary: Whether the user's personal brightness curve is valid. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.Same.UserModelBrightnessAdjustments
histogram.summary: When user changes brightness manually, if the previous change was caused by the model, then we log bucketized absolute brightness changes of the two adjustments. This metric records changes if they are in the same direction. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.TrainingCompleteDuration.NewCurve
histogram.summary: The time elapsed to complete training after which a new curve was generated. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.TrainingCompleteDuration.NoNewCurve
histogram.summary: The time elapsed to complete training after which no new curve was generated. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.UserAdjustmentEffect
histogram.summary: How user manual screen brightness adjustment changes the model. Chrome OS only.
